stream_context.summary: Kaze reviews and integrates Biobak’s full re-work of Course 5 (the ghost-ship) while live-debugging crashes caused by outdated texture-animation tables, adjusting N64-specific rendering (layers, combiners, texture formats, lighting) and planning design tweaks (coins, skybox fade, secret doors). He briefly shows progress on the western saloon hub, evaluates a new saloon music draft from Badub, and shares opinions on tools and workflow.

development_findings.summary: Course 5’s entire ghost-ship model has been rebuilt by Biobak: new geometry (1 700 tris hull), real railings, anchor, cannon holes, shredded sails, interior rooms, captain’s quarters, and treasure room lighting.
development_findings.quote: "First of all, dude, this is fucking sick looking … somehow we managed to do this with a thousand seven hundred triangles."

development_findings.summary: Kaze must down-res or split some window textures because N64 can’t mix the chosen alpha map with RGBA at current resolution.
development_findings.quote: "Unfortunately, this isn’t gonna work … this one will have to be a lower-res texture."

development_findings.summary: Transparent sails look nicer but create expensive overdraw; Kaze leans toward cut-out layer 4 to avoid Z-sorting cost.
Clear-color clears cost ~3 ms (~10 % of frame), so the project intentionally runs without a frame clear to stay within performance budget.
development_findings.quote: "Applying the clear color takes around three milliseconds which is like 10 percent of the render time of a frame."

development_findings.summary: New jail mechanic in western hub: each captured outlaw NPC will appear in a visible jail cell as stars are collected.
development_findings.quote: "Every time you catch an outlaw the outlaw will be in here, so this jail cell slowly fills up as you collect stars."

development_findings.summary: Saloon NPC count kept low to avoid lag and dialog bloat; Kaze emphasises meaningful text over crowd density.
Debug crash traced to obsolete texture-animation (TXS) tables after geometry shift (+700 units). Removing or updating them stops the matrix-underflow crash.
development_findings.quote: "It was TX channels. We need to remake the texture animations, that’s what's going on here."

development_findings.summary: Kaze plans skybox/sea fade: skybox clamped in view space, bottom fades to colour that outer sea ring also fades to.
Plank added to ship’s bow will become bouncy ‘diving board’ giving shortcut + possible Yoshi coin reward.
Library red-coin puzzle revised: sliding bookshelf now telegraphed with red books, scratches, and slight protrusion to reduce confusion.
Switch in sleeping-tables room will open external Shy Guy minigame door instead of spawning climb blocks; camera cutscene redesign required.
Engine and hack will be open-sourced at release; current optimized engine is private to avoid early leak.
development_findings.quote: "When I release this hack my engine will be public. I'll make the hack open source … at the same time."

context_findings.summary: Kaze distrusts modern tech (captchas, Windows 11, spyware) and prefers minimal tooling (rarely uses ChatGPT for Mario because “there’s no use case so far”).
Shows mix of excitement (praise for Biobak’s work) and frustration (compile crashes, texture limits), illustrating emotional highs and lows of N64 dev.
Believes many industry programmers are over-paid/under-worked; contrasts this with his own busy schedule.
context_findings.quote: "I think programmers in a 35-hour work week, they just work 10 hours … programmers are the laziest people on the planet."

biobak.summary: Delivered extensive Course 5 rework with embedded changelog; asks Kaze to read it before import.
Flags specific implementation needs (window brightness, sail combiner export issue) during stream.

badub.summary: Sent first draft of saloon theme; Kaze finds it too upbeat and similar to earlier zoo track; Badub agrees to revise.

zeina.summary: Briefly appears in chat; no development actions this session.

key_stories.title: Ghost-Ship Makeover
key_stories.summary: The old Course 5 looked dated, so Biobak rebuilt the entire ghost-ship. Kaze live-reviews the model, fixing texture formats, lighting combiners, and anchor shading in real time.
key_stories.challenge: Outdated visuals and performance issues in a three-year-old level.
key_stories.process: Biobak remodels; Kaze imports, adjusts layers, reduces textures, and resolves rendering constraints.
key_stories.outcome: New ship adopted; to-do list created for skybox fade, coins, plank bounce, and collision re-authoring.
key_stories.key_quote: "This room is so fucking cool … Nothing's the same in here."

key_stories.title: Mysterious Crash Hunt
key_stories.summary: After importing the new model, the game crashes with a matrix underflow. Kaze methodically removes objects until he identifies outdated texture-animation channels as the culprit.
key_stories.challenge: Game crashes immediately on load after import.
key_stories.process: Binary-style elimination of object types; suspects coins, then detect-channels; confirms TXS tables pointing to shifted geometry.
key_stories.outcome: Crash fixed; texture animations slated for rebuild.
key_stories.key_quote: "It was TX channels. We need to remake the texture animations."

key_stories.title: Saloon Music Redo
key_stories.summary: Badub submits a saloon track, but Kaze feels it clashes with the dark, quiet vibe. Composer and dev discuss references and agree to rework the piece.
key_stories.challenge: Music draft doesn’t fit atmosphere and resembles previous zoo level tune.
key_stories.process: Kaze plays sample, compares to reference pirate/western tunes, provides feedback in DM/live.
key_stories.outcome: Badub starts revising; new version expected next session.
key_stories.key_quote: "Too upbeat and happy … I was thinking it should sound like this."
